text: Panhormus, also known as Pylae or Pylai, was a settlement and station (mutatio) of ancient Cilicia, near the Cilician Gates (Greek: Kilikia Pylai) on the road between Tyana and Tarsus, inhabited during Roman Byzantine times. Its site is tentatively located near Han in Asiatic Turkey. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Cilicia Category:Former populated places in Turkey Category:Populated places of the Byzantine Empire Category:History of Mersin Province
title: Panhormus (Cilicia)
